answers.answer: I'd recommend a full work up.  While the change in eating is noticeable, I am more concerned about her incontinence.  Diabetes, kidney disease or female hormone issues may be the cause.  The paw licking is kind of a classic sign of allergies, but may be incidental or have another cause.There are several symptoms here that need to be tracked down and the only way to do that is a good physical exam and some carefully targeted blood analysis.keep us posted as to what you find.

question: my  2 yr. old spanial/shepard mix has always had a sensitive stomach.  I've had to feed her Iams   and will add an oil (olive, canola) She's done well on this diet.  Recently (last 3 months) her eating habits have changed:wanting to eat more alternating with refusing to eat on various days (inconsistent eating patterns)gaining weightexcesive paw lickingseveral weeks ago, small amounts of pee on carpet of friends house (1st time in house)yesterday peed, soaking her bed.Thank you for your assistance
title: change in eating
